intro: Thryallis hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy thryallis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Thryallis hirsuta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
